properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 7:01PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor...

At 700 PM EST...National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a
strong thunderstorm near Dreher Island State Park, or 10 miles west
of Lexington, moving northeast at 45 mph.

HAZARD...gusty winds 35 to 45 mph.

IMPACT...expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light, unsecured objects.

Some locations in the path of this storm include...
Columbia, Irmo, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, St. Andrews,
Ballentine, Harbison State Forest, Lighthouse Marina, Cedar Grove
Fire Station, South Shore Marina, Oswald Park, Lake Murray Marina,
Shull Island, Bundrick Island, Putnam's Landing, Siesta Cove Marina,
Murray, Pine Island, Hollow Creek Public Park and Seven Oaks.
properties.instruction:
Boaters on Lake Murray should move to shore and seek shelter. Strong,
erratic wind gusts and lightning are possible. If you can hear
thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

Persons in campgrounds should seek shelter until this storm passes.

NWSheadline: Strong Thunderstorms Will Impact Portions of northwestern Lexington...west central Richland and eastern Saluda Counties Until 730 PM EST.
